I think the account your sql server is running under does not have permission to write to this specific folder (Windows 7 security ğŸ˜’). You mentioned that a static path works but you didn't say which path you tried, I bet it is something outside the users folder. To isolate the issue first try selecting another folder (try something simple, d:\backup for example)

If this works but you wanna make sure you can backup to desktop you'll have to read a little bit about windows 7 security.

Check the permissions part in this article: http://www.windowsecurity.com/articles-tutorials/authentication_and_encryption/Desktops-Local-Rights-Privileges.html

I'm not an expert with windows security, it always confuses me, but I can summarize some possibilities for the machines that worked:
1. You are logged in as administrator thus your application have admin privileges.
2. Altered desktop folder permissions.
3. UAC is disabled !!
